title: Ticket #5065: Provide support for immutable job attributes (esp. x509 ones)
description:
SUBMIT_REQUIREMENTS provides a powerful tool for sysadmins - jobs must pass a given expression in order to be accepted in the queue. This is great for making sure jobs enter the queue in a certain state - but because of condor_qedit, there's no guarantee they stay in that state.

We propose adding a new configuration knobs:

  • IMMUTABLE_JOB_ATTRS a list of attributes provided by the admin that, once they have committed values, cannot be changed.
  • SYSTEM_IMMUTABLE_JOB_ATTRS same as above, but would be hard-coded in the param table by the developers to contain items like ClusterId, ProcId, MyType, etc.
  • PROTECTED_JOB_ATTRS a list of attributes provided by the admin that, once they have committed values, can only be altered by the queue super-user.
  • SYSTEM_PROTECTED_JOB_ATTRS same as above, but would be hard-coded in the param table by the developers.

Example use cases:

  1. Accounting groups: If SUBMIT_REQUIREMENTS checks the validity of an accounting group (for example, by validating that a given user is indeed a member of a certain unix group), then we shouldn't allow users to change it post-submit.
  2. X509 attributes: If we implement #5064, we would automatically set X509/VOMS attributes from cryptographically secure sources (connected socket, delegated proxy). We shouldn't allow these to be changed later.
